title: Our Work - Access Now
text:
Back to content

Our work
Access Now engages on a wide range of issues at the intersection of human rights and technology, advancing our mission through direct stakeholder engagement and deep collaboration with civil society partners and human rights defenders around the world.



Key issues




Artificial Intelligence







Connectivity







Content Governance







Covid-19







Cybersecurity







Data Protection







Digital Divide







Digital Identity Systems







Digital Security







Freedom of Expression







Internet Shutdowns







Net Neutrality







Privacy







Protest and Online Organizing







Surveillance







Transparency










Who we work with








Partnerships

Partnerships

Access Now is proud to work alongside a vast network of partners across civil society, academia, international and regional bodies, and both the public and private sectors.





Stakeholders






Private Sector
We urge companies to make their practices more transparent, accountable, and rights-respecting, and work with investors to center human rights in their engagement with the tech sector.




International Organizations
We strategically engage with multilateral institutions, such as the United Nations, to build international norms that strengthen digital rights and to encourage rights-respecting tech policy and governance.




Policymakers
We provide expert guidance to legislators, regulators, and others on best practices for rights-respecting policymaking in the digital age.






Regions






Meet Our Team
Work With Us

Partnerships

Partnerships

Access Now is proud to work alongside a vast network of partners across civil society, academia, international and regional bodies, and both the public and private sectors.





Stakeholders






Private Sector
We urge companies to make their practices more transparent, accountable, and rights-respecting, and work with investors to center human rights in their engagement with the tech sector.




International Organizations
We strategically engage with multilateral institutions, such as the United Nations, to build international norms that strengthen digital rights and to encourage rights-respecting tech policy and governance.
